issues.title: Owner Registry - Storage Duration (copied over)
issues.author: bledvina
issues.body:
Copied this over from: https://github.com/bdetwiler/draft-detecting-unwanted-location-trackers/issues/173

@cstapl:

Re: 3.15.2

In circumstances that indicate someone is possibly concerned the accessory has been used for unwanted tracking, e.g. upon NFC tap or other owner lookup that indicates the victim has physical access to the accessory (like a button push), we should consider extending the duration of the owner registry storage so that the victim has enough time to engage with the systems required to secure the owner information, e.g. law enforcement and the courts. This is another topic that is important to engage with victim advocacy groups on, for their expertise.

issues.title: Printing Non-SN Unique Identifiers (copied over)
issues.author: bledvina
issues.body:
Copied this issue over from: https://github.com/bdetwiler/draft-detecting-unwanted-location-trackers/issues/172

@cstapl:

3.14 & 3.14.1

Strong concerns that we’re making an allowance for vendors to opt out of printing the unique identifier in an easily accessible location on the physical device. It’s my understanding that those identifiers are a critical part of the physical evidence in law enforcement response to unwanted tracking related calls from victims, and in the prosecution of such cases. Recommend we discuss this issue with victim advocacy groups, and consider requiring all identifiers to be printed on the physical device.

issues.title: Pairing registry data validation (copied over)
issues.author: bledvina
issues.body:
Copied this over from: https://github.com/bdetwiler/draft-detecting-unwanted-location-trackers/issues/28

@siddikaparlak: 

From: [phil@aukilabs.com](mailto:phil@aukilabs.com)
To: authors of draft-detecting-unwanted-location-trackers, [nils@aukilabs.com](mailto:nils@aukilabs.com)
On: June 7, 2023

The proposal for Registration Data depends on honesty. In section 3.15. Pairing registry, how would the registry data be validated (prepaid SIM, gmail address)? Who would be responsible for managing the personal data with respect to GDPR? While many countries now require formal identification, many do not, leaving the ability to register anonymously available. Recording the IMEI of the owner's device could be valid too. Logging biometric data during registration, possibly with a government-issued identification document could also be considered.

@bledvina:

For the current internet draft the validation of the pairing data would be up to the party doing the accessory pairing.

This topic will likely be revisited as part of the IETF DULT WG, so tagging this with the appropriate label

issues.title: Methods to prevent customized firmware installments (copied over)
issues.author: bledvina
issues.body:
Copied over from: https://github.com/bdetwiler/draft-detecting-unwanted-location-trackers/issues/29

@siddikaparlak:

From: [phil@aukilabs.com](mailto:phil@aukilabs.com)
To: authors of draft-detecting-unwanted-location-trackers, [nils@aukilabs.com](mailto:nils@aukilabs.com)
On: June 7, 2023

Section 5. Firmware updates allow the user to update the accessory. How will customised firmware be prevented from being uploaded? Secure methods for software signing would need to be part of the technical requirements manufacturers would need to conform to.

@bledvina:

This is something the IETF WG will take up as part of the follow-on effort.

issues.title: Terminology within DULT WG
issues.author: siddikaparlak
issues.body: It might be a good idea to use a consistent terminology across all documents under DULT WG. This can perhaps be a standalone document.

issues.title: Sound maker requirement
issues.author: siddikaparlak
issues.body: As the tracker sizes getting smaller, it might be a challenge to fit in a sound maker. This issue is to initiate discussion on how to handle this in the accessory protocol.

issues.title: Review applicability section
issues.author: siddikaparlak
issues.body:
Review what kind of items the accessory protocol will be applicable to. Currently this section mentions "discoverability" and quantifies it with size requirements. 

https://github.com/ietf-wg-dult/accessory-protocol/blob/main/draft-ietf-dult-accessory-protocol.md#applicability
